FORGOT_PASSWORD.ENTER_CODE: Enter the code received in the registered email to generate a new password.
FORGOT_PASSWORD.CHOOSE_NEW_PASSWORD: Choose a new password for your user.

TERMS.TITLE: TERMS OF USE and PRIVACY POLICY
TERMS.PARTE1: These Terms of Use determine the rules, responsibilities, and obligations for the USER of the SOL platform (Online Bidding Solution).
TERMS.PARTE2: The Privacy Policy establishes the rules for the treatment of USER information and is integrated into this document in clauses 24 to 29.
TERMS.PARTE3: Except for specific provisions for each type of USER, all other provisions in this document apply to any USER.
TERMS.PARTE4: The USER declares to have read and expressed consent to all clauses contained in this document, with no doubts to be resolved.
TERMS.PARTE5: For a complete and correct understanding of this document, the following definitions will be used:
TERMS.PARTE6: Administrator: A Public Administration entity to which the Platform has been licensed;
TERMS.PARTE7: Platform: refers to the SOL Platform, licensed to the ADMINISTRATOR;
TERMS.PARTE8: User: refers to any and all Users authorized by the ADMINISTRATOR to access and use the Platform, including Association User, Supplier User, and Administrator User;
TERMS.PARTE9: Association User: a legal entity authorized by the ADMINISTRATOR to access and use the Platform under the Association permission;
TERMS.PARTE10: Supplier User: a legal entity authorized by the ADMINISTRATOR to access and use the Platform under the Supplier permission;
TERMS.PARTE11: Administrator User: an individual associated with the ADMINISTRATOR and authorized by it to access and use the Platform.
TERMS.PARTE12: Access to the Platform is granted by the USER providing login and access password.
TERMS.PARTE13: The USER will have access to specific sections, pages, and functionalities of the Platform, as per their permission.
TERMS.PARTE14: The USER's obligations, in addition to other obligations mentioned in this document, include:
TERMS.PARTE15: I - Performing security procedures to prevent unauthorized access to Platform access data;
TERMS.PARTE16: II - Creating a long and difficult-to-guess password, using letters, numbers, and symbols;
TERMS.PARTE17: III - Not using the Platform for illegal, immoral, or fraudulent activities;
TERMS.PARTE18: IV - Checking any available notifications on the Platform;
TERMS.PARTE19: V - Having the appropriate technical requirements for access and navigation on the Platform;
TERMS.PARTE20: VI - Checking and configuring their email account used for access so that any Platform-related messages are delivered to the inbox and not classified as spam.
TERMS.PARTE22: The ASSOCIATION USER must provide justification for any proposal not accepted or for the cancellation of a bidding process.
TERMS.PARTE23: Any bidding process created by the ASSOCIATION USER will only become public on the Platform after approval by the ADMINISTRATOR.
TERMS.PARTE24: After determining the winner and approving and awarding the bid's object, the ASSOCIATION USER and the proponent must formalize the respective contract.
TERMS.PARTE26: The Platform allows the SUPPLIER USER to submit proposals for the supply of products, with the criterion of the lowest price, unitary or global, to determine the bid's winner, provided that the Edital specifications are met.
TERMS.PARTE27: When submitting any proposal, the SUPPLIER USER declares to have all the technical and economic qualifications necessary to fulfill the Edital requirements, being legally qualified and having regular tax and labor obligations, and is solely and exclusively responsible for any damage, loss, claim, or demand arising from non-compliance.
TERMS.PARTE28: When submitting any proposal, the SUPPLIER USER declares to have all the technical and economic qualifications necessary to fulfill the Edital requirements, being legally qualified and having regular tax and labor obligations, and is solely and exclusively responsible for any damage, loss, claim, or demand arising from non-compliance.
TERMS.PARTE29: During the proposal submission period, the SUPPLIER USER may modify or delete a proposal already submitted, with the last proposal submitted before the end of the deadline considered valid for verification purposes.
TERMS.PARTE30: If the value of the proposal submitted by the SUPPLIER USER is equal to the value of a proposal submitted by another participant, the SUPPLIER USER and this participant will be notified to submit a new proposal, with the winner being the one who submitted the proposal with the lowest price. In case of a tie, the SUPPLIER USER who submitted the proposal in the shortest time after the submission period opens will be considered the winner.
TERMS.PARTE31: Any proposal that does not comply with the requirements established in the Edital will be excluded.
TERMS.PARTE32: All proposals submitted through the Platform, related to a specific bidding process, will be made available for viewing by the SUPPLIER USER after the bidding process is completed.
TERMS.PARTE33: After determining the winner and approving and awarding the bid's object, the SUPPLIER USER and the bid requester must formalize the respective contract.
TERMS.PARTE34: The USER is solely and exclusively responsible for the use of the Platform, and must bear any and all damages, losses, claims, or demands arising from its use in violation of the provisions of this document and legal regulations.
TERMS.PARTE35: The USER declares to own intellectual property rights over any content they send and publish on the Platform, and is solely and exclusively responsible for any damage, loss, claim, or demand arising from such submission and publication. If the content is not owned by the USER, the USER declares to have authorization from the rights holder to submit and publish it on the Platform.
TERMS.PARTE36: The USER is prohibited from sharing or disclosing, to third parties, any data or information existing on the Platform, to which they gained access due to their permission, and is responsible for any damage, loss, claim, or demand arising from such sharing or disclosure.
TERMS.PARTE37: The USER's access and use of the Platform do not imply the acquisition, assignment, or transfer of intellectual property rights to the Platform to the USER.
TERMS.PARTE38: The USER is prohibited from taking any action that constitutes a violation of intellectual property rights over the Platform, including, but not limited to, reproducing and/or marketing source codes, protocols, scripts, layouts, requirements, flows, and designs related to the Platform, which the USER may become aware of through their access and use.
TERMS.PARTE39: The USER is prohibited from performing any reverse engineering procedures on the Platform.
TERMS.PARTE40: Access and use records of the Platform will be collected, including:
TERMS.PARTE41: IP address of the USER in the following actions: (i) login/logout on the Platform, (ii) actions performed on the Platform, and (iii) consent to this document;
TERMS.PARTE42: Dates and times of: (i) login/logout on the Platform, (ii) actions performed by the USER on the Platform, and (iii) consent to this document;
TERMS.PARTE44: Information about the device or browser used for access to the Platform, including the browser version and operating system;
TERMS.PARTE45: Information about the use and/or viewing of sections, items, pages, and functionalities available on the Platform.
TERMS.PARTE46: Access and use records may be used by the ADMINISTRATOR for the following purposes:
TERMS.PARTE47: Use in auditing or investigating the occurrence of any illegal act or act violating any provision of this document;
TERMS.PARTE50: Use as evidence in administrative and/or judicial processes or proceedings.
TERMS.PARTE51: The email address provided by the USER may be used for the following purposes:
TERMS.PARTE52: Allowing access to the Platform, along with the password;
TERMS.PARTE53: Sending responses to any questions, requests, or information;
TERMS.PARTE54: Informing the USER about news, updates, and developments.
TERMS.PARTE55: USER data may not be transferred or made available to third parties without the USER's explicit consent.
TERMS.PARTE56: The above provision does not apply in cases of compliance with a court order.
TERMS.PARTE57: Access and use records and USER data will be stored on a secure server, following the available state-of-the-art technology.
TERMS.PARTE58: The USER's access to the Platform may be suspended or canceled in the event of non-compliance with legal or contractual obligations or the practice of acts that are inconsistent with what is established in this document or national legislation.
TERMS.PARTE59: The Platform may become unavailable due to: (i) previously informed maintenance; (ii) malware attacks, DDoS attacks, and actions by third parties that prevent its availability; (iii) server hosting issues; (iv) database issues; or (v) the occurrence of force majeure or acts of God, with the ADMINISTRATOR not being responsible for any damages, losses, claims, or demands to the USER arising from any of these situations.
TERMS.PARTE60: Tolerance of the USER's non-compliance with any provision of this document by the ADMINISTRATOR does not imply a waiver of what is established in this document.
TERMS.PARTE61: The USER should use the following contact channel for clarification regarding specific provisions of this document: admin@lacchain.com
TERMS.PARTE62: The jurisdiction of the Salvador/Natal and Bahia/Rio Grande do Norte District Court is chosen to resolve any disputes or controversies related to this document, with the express waiver of any other, regardless of privilege.
TERMS.PARTE63: The USER should use the following contact channel for clarification regarding specific provisions of this document: admin@lacchain.com

STEP_BID_REGISTER.EX_TYPE_BID: when creating a bidding, the entity determines the lots and items involved and configures the type of bidding based on the price. The type of bidding defines how proposals will be submitted and evaluated.
STEP_BID_REGISTER.EX_ITEM_PRICE: each lot contains only one item. In this type, suppliers can submit specific proposals for each item, without the obligation to submit proposals for all items. At the end of the bidding, the Entity may accept proposals from different suppliers for each item.
STEP_BID_REGISTER.EX_ALLOTMENT_PRICE: each lot can have multiple items. In this type of bidding, suppliers are required to submit proposals for the entire lot, covering all items listed within that specific lot. Similarly, the Entity will accept proposals per lot. If the bidding has two or more lots, the Association may choose different suppliers for each lot, based on the best value of the proposal.
STEP_BID_REGISTER.EX_GLOBAL_PRICE: the supplier is required to submit a proposal that covers all lots and items listed in the bidding. Only one supplier will be selected to provide all the bid products, goods, or services.
STEP_BID_REGISTER.EX_MODALITY_BID: when creating a bidding, it is possible to select the modality to which it belongs. This differentiation determines the visibility and participation of suppliers.
STEP_BID_REGISTER.EX_PUBLIC_OPEN: the bidding is public and can be viewed by all suppliers. They can freely submit proposals and do not receive an invitation to participate in the bidding.
STEP_BID_REGISTER.EX_OPEN_INVITATION: the bidding can be viewed by all suppliers. Suppliers receive an invitation to participate in the bidding. The Entity manages which suppliers it wants to send this invitation to.
STEP_BID_REGISTER.EX_CLOSE_INVITATION: only invited suppliers can view or participate in the bidding. Suppliers receive an invitation to participate in the bidding. The Entity manages which suppliers it wants to send this invitation to. If the supplier accepts the invitation, they must submit a proposal that cannot be edited later.
STEP_BID_REGISTER.TITLE_DESCRIPTION: Enter the title of the bidding
STEP_BID_REGISTER.ESPECIFIC_AGREEMENT: Select the specific agreement to which this bidding is related, choosing from the available options.
STEP_BID_REGISTER.EX_CLASSIFICATION_BID: Bids can be classified into three categories: Goods, Works, or Services. The classification is determined by the types of items being bid and does not affect the procedures and actions described in this manual.
STEP_BID_REGISTER.EX_ASSETS_BID: refers to the purchase of materials, such as office supplies (printers, computers, pens, and paper).
STEP_BID_REGISTER.EX_BID_WORK: involves the purchase of materials to carry out a construction, such as bricks, cement, or sand.
STEP_BID_REGISTER.EX_BID_SERVICE: involves the hiring of services, such as vehicle registration or hiring a bricklayer's workforce.
STEP_BID_REGISTER.EX_OPCIONAL_SITE: Members have the option to add the entity's website or a link to an important document.
STEP_BID_REGISTER.EX_DATE_START: The day after being approved by the reviewer, the bidding process begins, which means it will be open to receive proposals from suppliers.
STEP_BID_REGISTER.EX_DATE_END: Establish the date when the bidding will end, i.e., the final deadline for suppliers to submit proposals.
STEP_BID_REGISTER.EX_DAYS_TIEBREAKER: Set the deadline in days for when the bidding will be concluded, that is, the final deadline for suppliers to submit proposals.
STEP_BID_REGISTER.EX_DEADLINE_DELIVERY: Establish the time in days that the supplier will have to deliver the bid items after the contract is signed.
STEP_BID_REGISTER.EX_LOCAL_DELIVERY: Specify the location where the supplier must make the delivery of the bid products.
STEP_BID_REGISTER.EXPLICATION_ONE: After providing the 'Lot Name', 'Delivery Deadline', and 'Delivery Location', you can add the items that will be acquired through the bidding by clicking on 'Add item'.
STEP_BID_REGISTER.EXPLICATION_TWO: It is important to note that if the 'Delivery Deadline (days)' field is not filled, the previously established deadline during the bidding creation will be valid. However, if the field is filled, the specified deadline will prevail over the deadline established in the bidding creation. The same rule applies to the 'Delivery Location'.
STEP_BID_REGISTER.SEE_REGISTER: All suppliers registered in SOL will be shown.
STEP_BID_REGISTER.EX_SELECT: To select a specific supplier to send the invitation, simply search and click on their name.

CONTRACT_TEMPLATE.INSTRUCTIONS: Instructions for using tags in documents
CONTRACT_TEMPLATE.REPLACE: Change the field you want to replace with one of the related variables. The variable should be enclosed in curly braces as shown in the example, without spaces:
CONTRACT_TEMPLATE.STEP_1: If you want to use a variable that is inside a list, replace the word in the document as shown in the example:
CONTRACT_TEMPLATE.STEP_2: Within curly braces, put the name of the list followed by the # symbol to start, always without spaces.
CONTRACT_TEMPLATE.STEP_3: Open another set of curly braces to define the variable you need to use.
CONTRACT_TEMPLATE.STEP_4: At the end of the list, close with:

SUPPLIER_TAG.TITLE: Supplier Tags
SUPPLIER_TAG.T5: Legal representative's name of the supplier.

ASSOCIATION_TAG.TITLE: Entity Tags
ASSOCIATION_TAG.T5: Legal representative's name of the Entity.

BIDDING_TAG.TITLE: Bidding Tags
BIDDING_TAG.T2: Date when the bidding changed status to open.
BIDDING_TAG.T3: Date when the bidding changed status to closed.
BIDDING_TAG.T4: Date when the bidding is closed to receive proposals in the format (MM/DD/YYYY HH:mm:ss).
BIDDING_TAG.T5: Number of days defined in the bidding for delivery.

LOTE_TAG.TITLE: Lot Tags
LOTE_TAG.T1: List of names of the bidding lots.
LOTE_TAG.T3: Date of lot delivery in the format (MM/DD/YYYY).

CONTRACT_TAG.TITLE: Contract Tags
CONTRACT_TAG.T1: Day the contract was created in the format (DD).
CONTRACT_TAG.T2: Month the contract was created in the format (MM).
CONTRACT_TAG.T3: Year the contract was created in the format (YYYY).
CONTRACT_TAG.T4: Contract number in the format number/year.

OTHER_TAG.TITLE: Other Tags
OTHER_TAG.T1: Date the contract was created in the format (MM/DD/YYYY).
